Rishikesh Travel Guide

Location: Uttar Pradesh, India
Population: 260,343
Religion: Hinduism 94.81 % | Islam 2.45 % | Christianity 0.4 % | Sikhism 1.99 % | Jainism 0.21 % | Buddhism 0.02 %
Area: 11.5 Km2 (4.4 sq mi)
Language: Hindi and Garhwali

Weather: 29° C - 20° C

Ideal Duration: 2-3 Days

Best Time: Sep-Oct

Nearest Airport: Dehradun

Rishikesh is a spiritual town in Uttarakhand where the convergence of peace and adventure, delights the heart. It is famously called Rishikesh the Yoga Capital of the World sitting in the Himalayas with magical sound hymns echoed by old temples and yoga centres. The morning Aarti by the river bank would be the most sought-after experience in this pious land. There are a lot of ashrams and yoga retreats in Rishikesh for those willing to explore their inner self. Every wanderer will find serenity to nurture the art of mindfulness. People from all over the world travel to these areas on an inner-searching journey.

Rishikesh Tourism not only attracts seekers for spiritual advice but it is also an adventure tourist’s paradise. The white-water rafting adventures in the Ganges, with fast currents and awe-inspiring scenes provide an adrenalin rush unlike any other destination. The town is best known as a gateway to the Himalayas, where one can feel, the aesthetic beauty of nature.

Rishikesh is famous for its two historic suspension bridges over the Ganges, Laxman Jhula and Ram Jhula that form part of its identity. With these bridges as stepping stones, the spiritual mystique of Rishikesh provided a journey to an era gone by. The vibrant bazaars on either side of the river, along with craftspeople and snuggly street food make your day.

In the evening, the small riverside towns and pleasant cafes with the sounds of Gange’s music will be etched in your memory forever. It would be the most relaxing way after such a full day of discovery and exploration. With the setting of dusk, Go to Triveni Ghat to perform evening Aarti on the River Ganga. The riverbank will be filled with floating lamps. The sacred chantings and serene riverside fine-tune the spirit of tiredness.

Rishikesh is not only the location but a harmonious blend of spirituality, adventure, and natural majesty. There is a haven for everybody who needs some peace of mind, thrill or just to get away from the city centre. Every wanderer wants a soul-tickling journey to cherish it for a lifetime. Rishikesh is indeed every wanderer’s dream destination.

About Rishikesh

The moment of stepping into the mystical Rishikesh feels like your inner self is filled with peace. Rishikesh is a beautiful realm of spirituality where divinity connects to nature. This magical city by the banks of the holy Ganges River in the foothills of the Himalayas is a destination for every wanderlust. The first morning in Rishikesh starts with the healing rays of the sun caressing rugged mountain peaks and generating a warm glow on the water’s surface. The musical sounds of temple bells and the harmonized chants of prayers mixed with the rustling breeze in trees form a song that sang lyrics of millennia-year-old spirituality. Rishikesh is a pious hub of spirituality-inclined wanderers. Every year, thousands of pilgrims come to Rishikesh to seek solace and moments of self-introspection in the lap of divinity.

Every wanderer finds something to cherish in Rishikesh. Walking through the vibrant markets, the kaleidoscope of colours and smells oozed from within. Handicraft items, aroma candles, and traditional wear tempt everyone to vibrate with different histories of Rishikesh's cultural quilt. The vendors greeted me with friendly smiles and nuggets of local folklore.

The famous Laxman Jhula Bridge that hovers above and stretches across the holy Ganges offers mesmerizing views of rivers and hills. The Ghats are the spiritual heartbeat of Rishikesh where devotees dip into water asking for purification and rebirth. Yogis seamlessly perform asanas all along the riverbanks, each posture a tribute to tradition that suffuses Rishikesh.

Going to the Ganga Aarti is like an evening full of magic. With the setting of the sun, Ghats sprung to life with thousands of oil lamps. The melodic chants and movements of the priests feel rhythmical; the atmosphere controls my senses, instilling a sense of belonging with God.

And for travellers interested in adventure, Rishikesh provides the gateway to white water rafting and trekking along Himalayan trails. Both white-knuckle activities and the tranquil spirituality of this town highlight its unusual nature. Rishikesh Tourism stops time as you plunge into mountains hush and Ganges wisdom. It makes the heart peaceful. The views delight your soul, the temples nourish your spirit and food heals the mind. Whatever you do in Rishikesh, the memories stay forever.

Holiday Packages

Our exclusive Rishikesh Tour Packages are cherished by every wanderer. We offer a soul-soothing journey of Rishikesh without creating a hole in your wallet. In our Rishikesh Tour Package, we offer delightful tours of Rishikesh’s serene Ghats, the bliss of the Ganges, Yoga experience by the foothills of the Himalayas, and a thrill of senses with amazing water adventure activities. There is no need to worry about accommodation. We also offer expert-guided temple tours and curated experiences through our packages to help wanderers connect with Rishikesh’s spiritual essence.

Things to Do

Rishikesh is a soothing realm of spirituality and adventure. A wanderer’s day will never get dull here. There is something for everyone. If you are spiritually inclined, begin your day with yoga by the Ganges, dive deep into the tranquillity of ancient temples, and embrace the ethereal vibes of Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat. For thrill-seekers, the brave rapids of white-water rafting and many other adventures such as bungee jumping, zip-lining rock climbing, etc. will make their day blissful. Apart from the adventures, connect with nature at Shivpuri; meditate in the tranquil Beatles Ashram, and a riverside stroll to cherish the ambiance of Rishikesh forever.
